FRAUD.Definition: when someone lies to get money, cheat

CATCH.Definition: a hidden trick in an offer that seems good

SEMINAR.Definition: a class or meeting where people learned or talked about the subject

PILING INTO.Definition: going quickly into the place in a large group

TRADEMARK.Definition: something special that clearly showed who he was

CONVINCING.Definition: believable, making them think it was true

SPLITTING.Definition: dividing or sharing it into parts

BARGAIN.Definition: something that cost less than it was worth, a good buy

SHELL OUT.Definition: spend a lot of money on it

MENTORSHIP.Definition: help or advice from a more experienced person

SALES PITCH.Definition: a talk to try to sell them

MINGLED.Definition: mixed or talked with other people

FLATTERING.Definition: saying nice things to make them feel good or important

LUCRATIVE.Definition: bringing in a lot of money

YOUR FUTURE SELF.Definition: the person you will be in the future

UPSOLD.Definition: persuaded to buy something more expensive

SHAM.Definition: something fake that pretended to be real

GET-RICH-QUICK.Definition: make a lot of money very fast

IMMORAL.Definition: not right or good, against moral rules

UPSELLING.Definition: trying to get the customers to buy something more expensive

INSTITUTION.Definition: an important organisation, like a school or hospital

SEMINARS.Definition: classes or meetings where people learned about a topic

COUNTERED.Definition: answered back to oppose or argue

COUNTER.Definition: reply to or fight against it

ALLEGATION.Definition: the claim that he had done something wrong (not yet proven)

FISHY.Definition: strange or suspicious; not quite right

ADD UP.Definition: to make sense; to fit together correctly

FUDGING.Definition: changing them to make things look better than they were

ILLUMINATING.Definition: making things clear or easy to understand

OBJECTIONS.Definition: reasons for not agreeing or not wanting something

CATCH UP WITH.Definition: begin to have a negative effect on

PERSISTENT.Definition: continuing for a long time; not giving up

DECEPTIVE.Definition: making people believe something that was not true

MISLED.Definition: made to believe something that was not true

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: claims that he had done something wrong (not proven)

ALLEGED.Definition: said to be true, but not proven

SETTLEMENT.Definition: the agreement that had ended the legal argument

HANG OVER.Definition: cause worry or problems that would stay for some time

UPSELL FUNNEL.Definition: a sales plan that tried to get people to buy more expensive things step by step

STARK.Definition: very clear and easy to see

IRONY.Definition: a situation that is the opposite of what you expect

SUBSTANCE.Definition: the real meaning or quality behind something
